channel.title: Prs on Simon Storl-Schulke | 3D Generalist & Developer
channel.description: Recent content in Prs on Simon Storl-Schulke | 3D Generalist & Developer

item.title: A Cat in Time
item.description: All ProjectsA Cat in TimeUnity, Blender, MusikMobilegame for the City Museum Tübingen (still in development). To save the ghost of the cat mummy we travel to the year 1607. The player must solve a puzzle in each of four different historical museum rooms. Here I was responsible for 3D models and texturing, as well as music. The soundtrack has the special gimmic that the instruments change during the time shift.

item.title: Cloud Generation
item.description: All ProjectsCloud GenerationOSL, BlenderIn my bachelor thesis I dealt with the procedural generation of clouds in offline render engines. The focus was on user-friendliness. With the help of a few parameters it should be possible to create complex cloud shapes. The prototype was implemented in Blender with its real-time render engine Eevee. The implementation was then done with OSL (Open Shading Language) and tested with the Cycles render engine.

item.title: Evalgo
item.description: All ProjectsEvalgoGo, HTML, CSS, JavaScriptEvalgo is a course management system for students and lecturers that was developed for the course Current Developments in Online Media by Prof. Dirk Eisenbiegler on the topic Evaluation of Go for Web Development. . Instructors and tutors can write assignments using Markdown formatting and students can submit them. On the main page, the assignment, as well as the submissions of all students to the selected assignment can be found.

item.title: FUDGE
item.description: All ProjectsFUDGETypeScript, WebGL, HTML, CSSFurtwangen University Didactic Game Editor is a TypeScript based GameEngine especially for the teaching of Prof. Jirka Dell’Oro-Friedl. Here I worked on the implementation of mesh generation, OBJ mesh import and shaders. In the Chemistry with FUDGE project, we used the engine in very early stages to implement an atom orbital construction kit. .hero { display: none; } .

item.title: GameJams
item.description: All ProjectsGameJamsUnity, Godot, Blender, FL-StudioI participated in several GameJams during my studies. I took different roles - sometimes I was responsible for code, sometimes for 3D models and sometimes for music. So I was able to expand my knowledge in all areas and learn to work under strong time pressure in a team. Inbound: Earth | VR 360° Towerdefense Game. Satellites can be set to repel incoming alien spaceships from Earth.

item.title: Image Editor
item.description: All ProjectsImage EditorC#, GodotA simple image editor using C# and Godot, based on a non-destructive filter stack. The filters work with shaders in real time. The glsl shader code is generated from the filter stack at runtime. .hero { display: none; } .page { margin-top: 60px; width: 100%; max-width: 1400px !important; padding-right: 120px !important; } h1 { color: white; }

item.title: Realtime CG
item.description: All ProjectsRealtime CGGo, OpenGLZum Kurs Echtzeit Computergrafik von Rainer Duda entwickelte ich hier mit Go und OpenGL eine Demo zum Thema prozedurale Texturen und Fraktale. .hero { display: none; } .page { margin-top: 60px; width: 100%; max-width: 1400px !important; padding-right: 120px !important; } h1 { color: white; }

item.title: SABA Scan & Modelling
item.description: All ProjectsSABA Scan & ModellingBlender, Meshroom3D Scanning by drone and remodeling of the old SABA Farbik site in the Villingen Innovation Park in cooperation with Andreas Reich, Linus Ehmann and Sophie Tobisch. Among other things, I was responsible for the remodeling of the SABA main building based on the scanned data and references. .hero { display: none; } .page { margin-top: 60px; width: 100%; max-width: 1400px !

item.title: Tattoo Intros
item.description: All ProjectsEvalgoGo, HTML, CSS, JavaScriptEvalgo ist ein Kurs-Management System für Studierende und Dozenten, dass für den Kurs Aktuelle Entwicklungen im Bereich Online-Medien von Prof. Dirk Eisenbiegler zum Thema Evaluation von Go für Webdevelopment entwickelt wurde. Dozenten und Tutoren können Aufgabenstellungen mit Markdown-Formatierung verfassen und Studierende diese abgeben. Auf der Hauptseite sind die Aufgabenstellung, sowie die Abgaben aller Studierenden zur ausgewählten Aufgabe zu finden. Je nach Konfiguration sind Letztere für alle User oder nur für authorisierte Nutzer (Dozent oder Tutor) sichtbar.
